headline: Robinhood exec. says retail investors are feeling 'cautious'
summary: Robinhood (HOOD) chief brokerage officer Steve Quirk joins Asking for a Trend to talk about how retail investors are trading, the company's stock appreciation, and Robinhood's competitive advantage. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Robinhood Aims Social Platform at Reddit’s WallStreetBets
summary: The online brokerage is breaking into social media.  Before starting their trading platform, Robinhood founders Vlad Tenev and Baiju Bhatt planned an online community for sharing investing information.  Robinhood traders have long been more active on social media than other brokerages’ customers, comparing trading strategies with accompanying screenshots and commentary.

headline: Robinhood Markets (HOOD) Announces Q2 2025 Earnings Decline
summary: Recently, Robinhood Markets (HOOD) introduced Robinhood Social, a new feature enabling traders to share strategies and track transactions in real-time. This development emerges as the company's stock surged 58% over the last quarter, despite announcing a decline in Q2 2025 earnings. Contributing factors may include the aggressive stock buyback program and the inclusion in prominent growth-focused indices. Meanwhile, the broader market trends, such as the S&P 500 and Nasdaq hitting all-time...

headline: Kettle Named to Adweek's Fastest Growing Agencies List 2025
summary: Kettle, a digital-first creative agency known for its standout work for clients including Apple, T-Mobile and e.l.f. Beauty has been named to Adweek's 2025 Fastest Growing Agencies list. The annual ranking recognizes agencies from all over the world whose industry presence is on the rise, with distinction awarded to shops that have achieved significant growth over the past three years.

headline: Robinhood's New Service Is the Latest Bid to Power Up Social-Minded Retail Traders
summary: Chronically online digital natives are living their financial lives out in the open, and they think that can boost their portfolios. Traders are flexing paper gains on TikTok and swapping stock picks on Reddit and X, tactics far more socialized than those of the moneyed folks of the past.

headline: Why Robinhood (HOOD) Is Up 17.5% After Joining the S&P 500 Index and What’s Next
summary: Robinhood Markets was recently announced as a new addition to the S&P 500 index, replacing Caesars Entertainment, with the change having taken effect prior to September 22, 2025. This index inclusion reflects Robinhood’s transition from a commission-free trading app to a broader financial platform, drawing heightened attention from institutional investors and improving its market standing. We’ll explore how S&P 500 membership could amplify Robinhood’s appeal to institutional investors and...
